data.title: How to debug nodejs internal javascript code ?
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.11.2
- OS Version: Win7 x64

Steps to Reproduce:

1. set breakpoints on nodejs internal code, such as <node_internals>\http.js
2. press F5 to debug
3. process doesn't pause on breakpoint

data.title: AAGUID inside .vue files
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.11.2 (6eaebe3b9c70406d67c97779468c324a7a95db0e, 2017-04-13T08:03:11.395Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14393
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|vscode-eslint|dbaeumer|1.2.8|
|EditorConfig|EditorConfig|0.9.3|
|vue-snippets|hollowtree|0.1.1|
|vetur|octref|0.6.2|
|vscode-react-native|vsmobile|0.3.2|
|ReactSnippets|xabikos|1.2.1|;


---

Reported here too: https://github.com/octref/vetur/issues/110

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Have [vetur ](https://github.com/octref/vetur) installed, open a Vue.js project.
2. In a .vue file type a js comment and instead of `//` you get `/AAGUID/`.

data.title: Bash on Ubuntu (on Windows) on Visual Studio Code "carriage return" after certain number of characters
data.body:
Windows 10 Latest
VSCode Insiders Latest

If I set VSCode to use Bash on Ubuntu (on Windows) on Visual Studio Code it works perfectly, except after I type a certain number of characters it resets the cursor to the start of the line, no matter my window width

data.title: feature request: action.indentCursorLine
data.body:
feature request: action.indentCursorLine

In emacs a 'tab' key auto-indents the line where the cursor is. I would like a similar action which I might attach to tab key in vscode.

Currently, I select the line and hit tab. If I could just hit tab it would be more convenient

data.title: Once git sync fails, it always fails
data.body:
- Have changes in a git repo
- Click the `sync` command, it will fail
- Clean your repo's changes
- Click the `sync` command again, it will fail unecessarily

data.title: Theming: Tree defines 4 outline colors?
data.body: I am not sure why we need 4 (`listSelectionOutline`, `listFocusOutline`, `listInactiveFocusOutline`, `listHoverOutline`), we should not introduce new colors for outline but reuse the one we have already. If a user sets `highContrastOutline` in settings I would expect the tree to use this style.

data.title: When powershell is set as default console, console composing is wrong
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.11.2 (6eaebe3b9c70406d67c97779468c324a7a95db0e, 2017-04-13T08:03:11.395Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.15063
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|ecdc|mitchdenny|0.10.3|;


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Press Ctrl+` to open console in VS Code
2. The console composing is wrong.
![default](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9316590/25371868/76b0466a-29c5-11e7-99de-237e9839203f.PNG)
I don't know it's related to system language and powershell language setting. I'm using Windows 10 1703 pro in Chinese and powershell character is set to 936 (ANSI/OEM GBK). Using cmd as default console in VS code will not cause this problem.

data.title: Keep the files opened through Ctrl+P as tabs
data.body: I do `Ctrl+P` to open a file which shows up as tab. I do `Ctrl+P` again to open another file, which closes already opened file and opens another file. Please keep the first file open as well.

data.title: The problem matcher doesn't find all the errors
data.body:
The problem matcher doesn't find all the errors. This is weird ?!

- VSCode Version: 1.11.2
- OS Version: Debian Jessie

Minimal steps to reproduce:

errors (it's a file to test the problem matcher)
```
../path/to/file.cpp:295:6: error: no matching function
../file.hpp:68:72: error: no match for call to
../path/to/file.cpp:301:50: error: has incomplete type
```
tasks.json
```
{
    // See https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=733558
    // for the documentation about the tasks.json format
    "version": "0.1.0",
    "command": "cat",
    "isShellCommand": true,
    "tasks": [
        {
            "taskName": "errors",
            "isBuildCommand": true,
            "showOutput": "always",
            "problemMatcher": {
                "owner": "cpp",
                "pattern": {
                    "regexp": "^(.*):(\\d+):(\\d+):\\s+(warning|error):\\s+(.*)$",
                    "file": 1,
                    "line": 2,
                    "column": 3,
                    "severity": 4,
                    "message": 5
                }
            }
        }
    ]
}
```
2 errors are found after running the task, not 3, the first error is missing.

But this version works fine:
```
../path/file.cpp:295:6: error: no matching function
../file.hpp:68:72: error: no match for call to
../path/to/file.cpp:301:50: error: has incomplete type
```

data.title: "Restart to update" leaves terminal programs running after the program has closed

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.12.0-insider
- OS Version: Windows 10 x64

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open a long running process, like a node.js express application
2. When there's an update, use the "Restart Now"
3. The processes will remain running, and won't be killed

data.title: Disable emmet expansion on tab if autocomplete is enabled
data.body:
When users do eventually install the emmet extension (https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-emmet) they will get emmet expansions via the auto completions. In such case, the default emmet expansion on TAB should be disabled.

Users can opt out of the autocompletions by setting `emmet.autocomplete` to `false`

Also added telemetry for emmet customizations.
Since new Emmet 2.0 may not have some of these customizations, its important to see the usage of the same

cc @kieferrm, @alexandrudima, @jrieken , @egamma

data.title: Editor Typescript formatting on new line error
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version:
```
Version 1.11.2
Commit 6eaebe3b9c70406d67c97779468c324a7a95db0e
Date 2017-04-13T08:01:14.464Z
Shell 1.4.6
Renderer 53.0.2785.143
Node 6.5.0
```
- OS Version: Ubuntu 16.04

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open new tab
2. Set syntax to Typescript
3. Add this
```ts
class Smth {

  constructor() {/**/}
}
```
4. Put cursor at the end of `constructor` line and press enter
5. See that line with `constructor` lost it's indentation and cursor has wrong position on new line (there is should be 2 spaces before cursor)
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1944061/25360555/50481d5e-2952-11e7-939f-5aee463144c4.png)

Cant reproduce with any other indentation than 2 spaces or without comment block inside constructor brackets (have `{ /* */ }` in real app to prevent tslint empty block warning).

data.title: Git: Keep strike-through on deleted file names even when staged
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.12.0-insider (6e45311b5781d6550f469d0381d97d0d92e48f6b, 2017-04-21T09:00:30.173Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.5.0
---
Right now before a deleted file is staged, it's name shows with a strike-through, but once it is staged the strike-through goes away. It would be great if it was persisted, since it makes deleted file much easier to see.

data.title: April Endgame
data.body:
## Endgame Schedule
- *April 25*, Code freeze for the endgame
- *May 5*, Endgame done

#### Tuesday, April 25
- [x] Code freeze at 5pm PT
- [x] Ensure we have a green build on all platforms
- [x] All test items contain sufficiently comprehensive test descriptions by 6pm PT

#### Wednesday, April 26
- [x] Test plan items assigned
- [x] All closed feature-requests either have a verification-needed or on-testplan tag
- [x] Testing
- [x] [Verification needed](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues?q=is%3Aissue+-label%3Averified+is%3Aclosed+label%3Averification-needed)
- [x] Testing
- [x] Remind team members to assign issues that they intend to fix to the April milestone
- [x] Fixing (self-assigned, milestone assigned)
- [x] [Verification](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues?q=is%3Aissue+label%3Abug+-label%3Averified+is%3Aclosed+-label%3Aduplicate+-label%3Ainvalid+-label%3Aas-designed+milestone%3A%22April+2017%22)

#### Thursday, April 27
- [x] Fixing last issues
- [x] [Verification](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues?q=is%3Aissue+label%3Abug+-label%3Averified+is%3Aclosed+-label%3Aduplicate+-label%3Ainvalid+-label%3Aas-designed+milestone%3A%22April+2017%22)
- [x] Run [OSS tool](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-distro/blob/master/distro-tools/README.md) after merging shrink-wrap findings **endgame master**
  - *The LCA review of the ThirdPartyNotices.txt files is not needed anymore*
- [x] Check new OSS usage is entered into the [OSS registry](https://ossmsft.visualstudio.com/_apps/hub/ms.vss-oss-web.hub-oss) **endgame master**

#### Friday, April 28
- [x] Pause scheduled `insider` builds **@redmond**
- Satellite modules/npm packages ready, version updated, smoke tested
  - [x] vscode **@bpasero**
  - [x] yo generator **@aeschli**
  - [ ] vsce **@joaomoreno**
  - [x] node debug **@weinand**
  - [ ] node debug2 **@roblourens**
- [x] Translation input - **@dbaeumer**
- [x] All issues [verified](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/wiki/Issue-Tracking#verification)
- [x] Fixing (only critical bugs - no string changes)
- [Smoketest](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/wiki/Smoke-Test)
  - [x] Windows - @roblourens 
  - [x] OS X - @rebornix  
  - [x] Linux - @owner
- [x] All release notes updated - release notes are collected in a file named *`Month_Year.md`* in this [repo directory](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-docs/blob/vnext/release-notes/)
  - [ ] @alexandrudima
  - [x] @weinand
  - [x] @chrmarti
  - [x] @tyriar
  - [x] @dbaeumer
  - [x] @bpasero
  - [x] @egamma
  - [x] @isidorn
  - [x] @joaomoreno
  - [x] @jrieken
  - [x] @kieferrm
  - [x] @aeschli
  - [x] @rebornix
  - [x] @ramya-rao-a
  - [x] @roblourens
  - [x] @sandy081
  - [x] @mjbvz
  - [x] @mousetraps
- [x] Acknowledge pull requests in release notes. We acknowledge PRs from outside the team. Use the [thankyou](https://vscode-tools.azurewebsites.net/#acknowledgePRs) tool to generate the initial contents of the section. **owner**
- [x] Anotable fixes in the release notes **@all**
- When done fixing/verifying and there are changes since last build at the end of day PT
  - [x] Trigger new insider build and publish it manually **@owner**

##### Friday/Monday
- [x] Freeze `insider` builds - **endgame master**
- [x] Branch code to `release/<x.y>` and release `master` - **endgame master**
- [x] Bump up the version in `package.json` - **endgame master**
- [x] Announce master is open for business **endgame master**
- [x] Polish release notes **@redmond**

##### Monday - Wednesday
- [x] Polish release notes **@redmond**
- [x] Cherry-pick hand-picked and reviewed changes to `release/<x.y>` **@owner**
- [x] Build `Insider` from `release/<x.y>` **endgame master**
- [x] Manually release `Insider` **endgame master**
- [ ] Documentation updated

- [x] Add a git tag to `HEAD` of `release/<x.y>` in format `x.y.z` **endgame master**
- [x] Enable scheduled `insider` builds **endgame master**
- [x] Twitter announcement **@seanmcbreen**

data.title: Fix TS 2.3.1 Compiler Errors in VSCode src/workbench
data.body:
From: https://github.com/Microsoft/TypeScript/issues/15352

TS 2.3.1 introduced a breaking change by [switching to covariant types for callbacks](https://github.com/Microsoft/TypeScript/wiki/Breaking-Changes#covariance-in-callback-parameters). This change tries to fix these compiler errors in the workbench codebase

data.title: Fix VSCode/Extensions for TS 2.3.1
data.body:
From: https://github.com/Microsoft/TypeScript/issues/15352

TS 2.3.1 introduced a breaking change by [switching to covariant types for callbacks](https://github.com/Microsoft/TypeScript/wiki/Breaking-Changes#covariance-in-callback-parameters). This change tries to fix these compiler errors in the extensions codebase
